node.title: Israel’s energy minister could not access Monday talks in her wheelchair.
node.alt: Karine Elharrar, the Israeli minister of energy, before a meeting with Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain on Tuesday. Mr. Johnson apologized for the lack of wheelchair access.
node.content: ["British officials, including Prime Minister Boris Johnson, and COP26 organizers have apologized to Israel\u2019s energy minister after she was unable to attend Monday\u2019s events because she could not access the venue in her wheelchair.", "Karine Elharrar, who has muscular dystrophy, arrived at one of the entrances to the event\u2019s compound but her vehicle was not allowed to enter, and the remaining distance was too far for her to go in her wheelchair, she told Israeli media. She waited for two hours and was eventually offered a shuttle to the site, but the shuttle was not wheelchair accessible, she said.", "\u201cI came to COP26 to meet my counterparts in the world and advance our joint struggle against the climate crisis,\u201d Ms. Elharrar wrote on Twitter. \u201cIt\u2019s sad that the United Nations, which promotes accessibility for people with disabilities, in 2021 doesn\u2019t worry about accessibility at its own events.\u201d", "Others in wheelchairs have successfully gained access to the conference facilities, which include elevators, ramps and accessible bathrooms, and Ms. Elharrar was in attendance on Tuesday.", "George Eustice, Britain\u2019s environment secretary, said in an interview on BBC Radio 4 that \u201cmost of the other entrances\u201d had wheelchair access, but the particular entrance Ms. Elharrar arrived at on Monday was not prepared for her.", "\u201cIt was because she came to an entrance where they didn\u2019t have that provision,\u201d he said. \u201cBut we obviously deeply regret that that was the case, and action should have been taken to sort that out.\u201d", "COP26 organizers wrote on Twitter that Ms. Elharrar\u2019s experience was \u201ca genuine mistake and we have apologized for that.\u201d The event \u201cmust be inclusive and accessible to all and the venue is designed to facilitate that,\u201d the organizers wrote.", "Mr. Johnson personally apologized to Ms. Elharrar at a meeting on Tuesday, according to the Times of Israel.", "\u201cI gather there was some confusion with the arrangements yesterday,\u201d Mr. Johnson told her, according to the newspaper. \u201cI am very, very sorry about that.\u201d", "Other apologies came from Neil Wigan, the British ambassador to Israel, and James Cleverly, the foreign office minister for the Middle East and North Africa."]
